data.formatted_address: Trường Yên, Hoa Lư, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Hoa Lư Ancient Capital

reviews.text:
Understand from the guide that this place used to be the city instead of Hanoi of northern Vietnam. The palace was seated on a strategic plain for defense purposes. As such, we could see the mountains located behind and the river right in front.

There were a few historical temples here as well, worshipping the old kings I supposed (understood from the tour guide). If you are into historical architecture, I’m sure you would like this place. Not a really big place. I remembered we took about an hour going to the different structures located within the compound.

The Hoa Lu Ancient capital is a wonderful place to explore if you're interested in experiencing the rich history and culture of Vietnam. To fully appreciate this destination, I highly recommend hiring a tour guide. However, please keep in mind that it can be quite busy with both locals and tourists, so some patience may be required.
Restrooms are available near the entrance and are provided by local street vendors for a fee. Food from street vendors is safe to eat.
It's worth noting that locals may take a picture of you at the entry and later try to sell it to you. If you decide to purchase any of these pictures, I recommend not paying more than one US dollar per picture.

Beautiful temple and site to learn more about Vietnamese history. The story of the conspiracies surrounding the first feudal kings death and swift coronation of the second, maybe schemed by the queen can be found back in the artwork surrounding the site. The area also loans itself for cycling really well and has beautiful limestone mountains

It was an amazing experience visiting this ancient capital, I booked my Day tour package with Klook for Ninh Bin. The weather was not that good when I was there and it was very cloudy so couldn't enjoy the viewpoints.
So here you can see some temples inside the complex which are very beautiful indeed.
Overall it was a great experience visiting here and experiencing the ancient vibes.

We had probably too high expectations of the whole place. It is interesting. But if you have planned to go to visit the tombs in Hue (emperor tombs) you may think twice before you go and visit this place. Maybe it is more interesting with a guide.

It has some nice viewpoints though.

Located in the relic complex in the ancient capital of Hoa Lu, the mausoleum of King Le Dai Hanh (941 - 1005) is located at the foot of Ma Yen mountain. The area of ​​the mausoleum is quite modest, the access road is dirt road, on rainy days it is very difficult to enter due to flooded and muddy water. The current king's mausoleum has been restored so it is quite new, with pillars, tombs and stele houses. With his achievements in defeating foreign invaders, King Le Dai Hanh is one of the heroes of ancient Vietnam.

data.formatted_address: 6WJP+H9, Ninh Xuân, Hoa Lư District, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Viewpoint Đầm sen Hang múa

reviews.text: Awesome views surrounding the little hill that we climbed. One needs to buy ticket to enter the premises. The climb was pretty physical as the steps were very high. Need to rest along the way to ensure that we were alive when we got to the top. The views up there were simply breathtaking and I could assure you that the climb was definitely worth it. Of course, do make sure your physical condition is good before embarking on the climb. Alternatively, can always take breaks along the way as there were many break stops. Water is sold at certain points but the prices increased as it gets higher.

Early rise before the guides and big buses js recommended.

Do not stop for the locals yelling to park your motorbike at theirs. Keep going, you can park it at the park.

Beautiful viewpoint, and worth climbing the stairs all the way. Please be careful when it rains, it can be slippery in some areas. There is a fee of 100k vnd payable at the entrance. We went around 8am and it was not busy at all, it can get really busy later in the morning.

Lovely views, not a particularly difficult viewpoint hike as it's quick and all stairs but they can be slippery. It took us about 15/20 minutes to get to the top (late 20's English couple) but we did it at 10am and it was already 32 degrees so incredibly hot.
There is not much shade on the walk up, and only a little bit once you're at the top so bring plenty of water and suncream.
You also have to pay a fee of 100k dong to enter Hang Mua village which includes lotus fields, caves and the viewpoint hike, and there are a few cafes to cool down in after you're done.

Beautiful views. Have to buy a ticket to enter. Beware of scammers trying to get you to park before the ticket gate. Will have to pay for parking no matter what, but might as well do so close to the gate. Stairs to the top are killer bring lots of water.

data.formatted_address: Gia Viễn District, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Van Long Wetland Nature Reserve

reviews.text: What a nice boat ride. We were alone on our boat and only saw very few other boats. The views are amazing and it's not super touristy, like so many other boat rides. We spotted a lot of birds and butterflies. The short ride through the cave is pretty cool and our captain was really nice (and didn't ask for tip, we gave him one anyways). Price including parking was 100.000 vnd per person, what feels pretty fair for how long you are on the water.

My experience is a bit different than the others. If you want to go straight to the boat ride, please see the other reviews. I rented a scooter for my beautiful lady and I, and this review is from that perspective. We rode in no boats, although we did see a bus load of tourists in line to do just that. We were hot with a 50 km breeze of our creating. I cannot imagine what they felt breeze-free. 103 degrees, even in the shade you will be sweating profusely. I rented the scooter in Ninh Binh and it takes about 30 minutes with no stops. We stopped in many places along the way and even a quaint village adjacent to Van Long. At Van Long, we hiked our own trail, saw beautiful birds and butterflies. We even spotted a snake slicing atop the water (it's Vietnam). If I had the choice again,  I would do it the same way. The bird? A Gray-headed Swamphen, a first for me.

(September 2023)
Someone from the restaurant near the parking area pointed us to the point where you could buy the tickets for the boat, it was a few meters away from the “pier”. Back then it cost 100k per person and at the end of the ride after cca 80 minutes, we gave our guide a tip but we absolutely weren’t pressured to. We got very lucky with the weather, we wore hats because it was extremely sunny and some ladies were selling umbrellas nearby. We didn’t get to see monkeys but the scenery was stunning nevertheless. I was mad at myself for not being able to speak Vietnamese more because our guide was lovely and tried to tell us about the formations in caves, animals and plants, I just couldn’t understand him 🥲 It’s a shame that there is a language barrier in most of the touristic places in Vietnam.

Van Long is considered the largest inland wetland in the Northern Delta of Vietnam. The reserve is located in 7 communes: Gia Hung, Lien Son, Gia Hoa, Gia Van, Gia Lap, Gia Tan, Gia Thanh in Gia Vien district, Ninh Binh province.
Its area of exceptional biodiversity has a limestone karst surrounded by the freshwater lake, marshes and swamps that is habitant for the largest population of the Delacour's langur and other immense collection of flora and fauna.
What an experience, we chose this place over Tam Coc and Trang An and totally worth it. Beautiful nature reserve, we saw multiple bird species, snakes and were only us on the whole lake.

data.formatted_address: 6WFF+CG, Ninh Hải, Hoa Lư District, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Buffalo Cave

reviews.text: A fun little activity to do if especially if you have a push bike. Its a beautiful scenic route to this spot. I went as sunset (4pm) and there were 3 other people finishing up. Upon arrival you will see the Buffalo (sadly tied up), some history about the family who runs it and the reasoning for starting this business. At 75000Dong you get a beverage (alcoholic or not), to feed some baby ducklings, the water buffalo, enter a cave (difficult to climb through), a waterfall, “pool”, and fish with sticks. I think the price is a bit steep, especially since when I went I kept asking if I could do the feedings rather than just get a beverage. Then the fishing wasn’t really fishing - nothing was really explained and was more of a do it yourself. Overall pretty cool to do once with mates. (I was solo and was still nice)

Cool spot to visit. Unique! Definitely feel that the animal welfare has some possible improvements. But they seem to be generally in good shape. Also really nice that they have the signs with info and history in English, interesting to read about the cave. Nice place for some pictures as well.

75k each on entry and it comes with a drink

Such a fun activity in Ninh Binh!! Only 75000 dong and you get a free drink included. You can feed the ducks and buffalo, catch fish and explore the cave. Beautiful location and the owner is so kind. Definitely worth visiting! You’re also able to visit again without paying the fee again if you want to go a different day.

A really nice experience. Didn't feel like a tourist money trap. Friendly, authentic people.
We got to feed the ducklings and buffalo. Walked around the rice field, and saw the waterfall. Enjoyed a free drink too!

Beautiful place to visit. We relaxed there for almost 2 days. After you pay 75k VND you could come back anytime after and enjoy free Vietnamese tea, feed ducks, buffalo (they saved her from bad conditions), fishing and last but not least you can visit the cave with waterfall and take a natural shower there 💚 thank you for this wonderful experience 🙏🏼

reviews.text:
This cave is super out of the way, probably worth a stop only if you happen to pass by.
Very under-maintained despite the 50k/person entrance fee, and the staff couldn't be bothered with us beyond taking our money and passing us a torch. No barricades so it's a free for all once you're inside. With limited lighting in the cave, it was extremelyyyyy dark, so the torch they gave us came in handy. Some rubbish left behind by previous visitors also remained in the cave.
Nevertheless, it was still pretty fun to explore and climb around.

It’s quite out of the way. Not well maintained, only some lights were working.
You have to pay 40,000 vnd per person (there wasn’t any signage, we were told to pay after going to the cave) and they make you pay for parking 20,000 vnd.
But the cave itself was cool and interesting. Took about 10-15 mins.

Arrived at this cave on Sunday afternoon. No one was at the ticket booth. Went into the cave and no lights were on. The place gets pitch black and your flashlight on your phone will not let you see much. Ended up getting lost after a few minutes, but thankfully made my way out. The actual inside of the cave was really nice, it just needs some operable lights. At the end, I was looking for someone to pay, but no one was around. Either bring a powerful light, or consider visiting a different cave.
Ok

reviews.text: Waterpark is not open

Very Refreshing and astonishing

Review of Tulip Water Park, Ninh Binh
Tulip Water Park in Ninh Binh is an outstanding entertainment destination, attracting many tourists, especially families and groups of young people. With spacious space and modern design, the park brings exciting and refreshing experiences.

Advantage:

Diverse water games:
Tulip Water Park has a variety of water games such as water slides, lazy river, wave pool and children's play area. These games give visitors a feeling of excitement and relaxation, suitable for all ages.
Modern facilities:
The park is equipped with modern facilities, including changing areas, lockers, and clean restrooms. Customer safety is always top priority with rescue teams on duty in key areas.
Covenient service:
The park offers many convenient services such as restaurants, cafes, and souvenir shops. Guests can enjoy snacks and cool drinks after playing in the water.
Event organization activities:
Tulip Water Park also regularly organizes events, entertainment programs and team-building activities, creating more attraction for visitors.
Defect:

Crowded during high season:
During holidays, weekends or summer, the park can be very crowded, leading to long lines at rides and services.
Ticket prices and service costs:
Some visitors have reported that entrance ticket prices and service costs in the park can be quite high compared to similar amusement parks.
Maintenance and cleaning:
Although the park has modern facilities, sometimes maintenance and cleaning are not done regularly, affecting the visitor experience.
In short, Tulip Ninh Binh water park is an interesting destination and worth experiencing, especially on hot summer days. However, visitors should choose an appropriate time to avoid crowding and should prepare in advance about costs.

data.formatted_address: Ninh Hải, Hoa Lư, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Tam Cốc-Bích Động

reviews.text: The area is not wide but surrounding by beautiful limestone mountains, caves, and lush rice paddies on the two banks of Ngo Dong River. Take a boat riding along the river or hire a bike cycling around the village. The weather from May to June is ideal. The rice fields turn golden, and the lagoon outside the entrance to Bich Dong Cave is filled with blooming lotuses. However, its weather will be very hot during summer days, and there is a likelihood of rainfall.
This place is stunning! It's got these lush green limestone mountains and tons of gorgeous, long caves. You absolutely have to take a boat ride when you're there.

Opens 7:30. My hotel told me 7:00…. But now in June opening time 7:30.
You have to buy the tickets 300 m from the boats, I suggest you to buy on line tickets.
You can have the full boat and no need to wait for others for  half million. I decided I want go alone.
Not mandatory the life jackets.

You give a tip to the boat person and can stop to a photo or view point, I gave him 50K to spot for the photo.
You can see my photos , very nice view point.
@soniagivray

Everything you need to know:
First, you must buy tickets at the ticket office which is 300m away. The ticket price is 250k per person or 500k for a private boat if you are a single. Otherwise you can have up to 4 people (I think) on a boat but it’s still 250k per person. The ticket price includes an electric shuttle from the ticket office to the starting point and back.

The ticket price also includes as many stops along the river as you like BUT if you don’t tell the boat driver, they won’t make any stops. Without stops the total time up and down the river is a little less than 1.5 hours.

There are about 4 potentially interesting stops along the river. I suggest stopping at the end for a short walk, as it’s nice to stretch the legs and walk over a few beautiful bridges. The water is also cleanest there. The other stop you ABSOLUTELY MUST make is Gioi Ravine. You’ll see a sign for it along the river, before entering the second cave. It’s a short 5-10 minute walk through narrow rocks but it’s vertical and up stairs the entire way. At the top is the most beautiful viewpoint, it’s top 3 best places we’ve seen in Vietnam. So many boats passed this stop and it’s a shame because this is a MUST do.

There is only one route up and back, you’ll pass beautiful rice paddies and go through 3 caves in a nice looking boat as you’re towed along the river by the drivers feet. I strongly suggest you bring an umbrella to protect from the sun and water because it gets hot! There was only shade in the caves and at stopping points along the river. We went around 10am in May and it wasn’t too crowded on the river, maybe a bit on the way back.

It’s also important to point out the boat drivers are paid with your ticket price, so I don’t understand why people are suggesting you tip. Most boat drivers will try to sell you artwork or similar towards the end and they will strongly suggest you tip them. This was the only negative for us, as our driver demanded we tip her for the last 5 minutes of the trip. Tipping is not customary in Vietnam so we did not tip, and I’m from the US. Of course feel free to tip if you like but you definitely shouldn’t feel required to and it definitely shouldn’t be demanded by the drivers. Hope this helps.

We rode the hotel bikes out from the town.an easy ride and an enjoyable hike, bring money for bike parking, entry and the boat ride to the entry if the waters high. Well worth the hike to the top too!!

worth visiting at least once and giving some dinner/snacks by the lake. Prices are not too costly and worth it

data.formatted_address: 6WJQ+C43, Ninh Xuân, Hoa Lư, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Hang Múa (Mua Caves)

reviews.text:
I think this is a must do if you're in the area. Id recommend going early to avoid the crowds.. if you cant then go a little later for sunset as it will be a little cooler.

There is two peaks you can see, one being higher and better than the other. There is 500 steps to the top of the tallest one, the steps range in size and height which makes for a fun sweaty ascent.

My girlfriend and I ripped to the top pretty quickly as we were rushing for the sunset. Bring water

View from the top is amazing and worth it

Beautiful place! I would suggest rather going there for the lotus garden and the hike rather than the caves but you only pay one entrance ticket to see all. When you climb the mountain of steps, GO LEFT NOT RIGHT. Right is the same view as left but without the beautiful stone dragon. It takes about 30 minutes to get up and you will sweat so much, its like a shower. Bring a hat and sunscreen, you can buy cold drinks at the bottom.

Not as physically difficult as we were expecting which was nice. Great views, we did it on a cloudy day after a rainstorm so it was more quiet than usual. Great views and the lily pond at the bottom was an unexpected bonus.

We went by scooter from Tam Coc and arrived at 6 am. Having read the reviews of the parking scams, we were prepared to speed up to avoid these, but they weren't awake yet. Parked our scooter inside the gate for 10k. tickets were 100k each. We could see some people at the top shortly after we started, but walked right in we only came across 10 - 15 people the whole time.

The climb is steep with uneven steps. But it's worth it once you reach the top. We aren't in peak physical shape, but we took a few breaks on the way up, and it wasn't bad. It was about 25 degrees out when we arrived. Would suggest good footwear. I wore sneakers while my wife wore sandals and had no issues.

We went left to the dragon and the higher peak. There isn't much of a pathway to the dragon. This is where better footwear would be the biggest benefit. The views were spectacular from the pagoda and the dragon.

The cave and pathways through the lotus fields were at the bottom. We quickly checked these out after. But the climb we the main attraction her. Although the lotus fields were not in bloom when we were there.

If you come this early, bring water with you as none of the many shops were open. They were starting to open went we were leaving at 7:30. The tour busses were starting to arrive at this time as well, but it was still fairly quiet.

Would definitely do this again if we ever return.

The main attraction is not the cave, but the 2 look out points up the steep slope. In fact, the cave has nothing and with a short walk, it will lead to an open area.

Climbing the steps up the pagodas seems to be the main attraction. The view is exhilarating once you reach either top. Yes, there are 2 peaks you can hike.

data.formatted_address: Tam Coc Rd, Ninh Hải, Tam Coc, Ninh Bình 430000, Vietnam
data.name: Vietnam easy go travel

reviews.text: We did a tour with the guide named Long and it was one of the most beautiful experiences I have ever had in Vietnam, if not the most beautiful. It was truly amazing to ride bikes, cook, and participate in a variety of activities that allowed us to immerse ourselves in the local culture. Long was exceptional: he showed us many new things, made us feel at home, and introduced us to local fruits and flavors. His friendliness made everything even more fun. Thank you so much, Long, for giving us unforgettable moments. This tour agency is highly recommended!

Did a 1 day bicycling tour around Ninh Binh with tour guide Viet and had the most amazing time. The day was well planned out with fun activities such as fishing, kayaking and a cooking class. The scenery is absolutely stunning and it was such a good way to enjoy it from the bike. The tour never felt rushed and I felt very well looked after by Viet. I would recommend to bring an extra change of clothes as you will get a little muddy during some of the activities. Highly recommended this place and specifically the bicycle tour!

Didn’t know what to expect but had THE MOST FUN on this Ninh Binh motorbike tour! Our rider Lao was super friendly and hilarious, taught us heaps of fun facts about the local region and also took great photos of us. Make sure to bring a change of clothes as you will get muddy but the experience is fun as. Also the spring rolls we made in our cooking class were delicious, go book in now :)
Tour was very nice and guide was super funny. Also people in the office were very helpful even if we booked a bus at an other company. He also gave us very nice tipps!

Would highly not recommend anyone to book through them , they are uncertain of their prices amongst their own team,I had paid and opted for me and my partner for. Mini limousine and were asked to report at 7 am (as they asked what time do you want to reach ha long to which I said 10:30)
They said please be ready we will depart at 7:00 am

We were ready and got picked up by one person from our hotel and were left outside another booking travel agency la office who dint really treat us well but rather started yelling at us when I asked them why are we on a mini bus when we had booked a limousine - they abruptly answered go to your booking agent - whereas the booking agent office was shut and dint answer until we had to leave as it was getting late (the bus left at 7:30 and told us will reach at 11:30(extremely unprofessional )
Guys please don't enter the office because it looks big and professional you can rather go to a smaller looking office atleast they will give you value for money and be honest

data.formatted_address: 6W54+MVH, Cách bến đò 50m, Văn Lâm, Hoa Lư, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Linh coc

reviews.text: Thanks to the advice from our hotel, Tam Coc Gardens,  we knew how much to pay in advance and what tip is expected at the end. It was a wonderful experience. We arrived at 0830 and had the river and caves to ourselves most of the time. We paid 160k in advance and were so delighted with our “guide” that we gave her 200k (100k was recommendation). The views are stunning, and we saw kingfishers, pigs, “concords” and many bats.

Rude grandmas pushing you to book an overpriced boat tour of 1h (300k). Ended up going to the official harbour. Search for "Trang An Departure Boat", that's what you're looking for. (Closed price of 250k/person for a 3h ride, and no tip requested).
High price and other options around with better views. After paying 300,000 she pushed the boat of the dock and demanded another 100,000 for tip after agreeing on the price.

Trip was good but at the end of the trip they’re begging for tip money. We ended up paying 500000 dong for three people including the tip and they were still asking for more. The boat ride is about 1hr.

If you want to do a boat tour without having the feeling you are in some kind of Disneyland, this is a really good place to go. They row you all the way up to the bird park and the trip takes about 75 minutes. There are 3 caves in rotal they row you through. The final one is located in the birdpark and is 500 metres long. We saw a colony of bats hanging in there. This big cave is the only place you will see more boats (see my photos). But you go a little bit further through this cave than the people that start from the birdpark. So you will see the end of this cave and they don't. You row back the same way. Buying the ticket feels a bit steange. A man pointing to his shiny buttons like 'I am the official' sells you tickets that you can bargain about. But in all we absolutely loved this tour very much as it was so quiet and peaceful.

reviews.text:
5/5 Must be in your itinerary in Hanoi trip 🇻🇳
Just wow camera can’t capture all landscape and caves and lake and baits 👍🫶🏻

The whole process of this tourism area was one of the best operations I observed. Though the activity of riding a boat and passing through some of the little caves are just ordinary for adventurers, it is still amazing to take note that the landscape of this river is what makes the journey different and astounding.

Visiting Tràng An in Ninh Binh was one of the most incredible experiences of my life. The scenery is absolutely breathtaking, and the fact that it was a filming location for "Kong: Skull Island" added an extra layer of excitement. As I floated through the river, I could vividly imagine scenes from the movie, with towering limestone cliffs and lush greenery all around. The numerous temples and religious sites along the tour were awe-inspiring and added to the sense of wonder. This is a must-visit destination if you're in Hanoi, Vietnam. It's perfect for all ages and far surpasses any textbook or Discovery Channel show. Experiencing Tràng An firsthand is truly a once-in-a-lifetime moment. Highly recommended!

The whole process of this tourism area was one of the best operations I observed. Though the activity of riding a boat and passing through some of the little caves are just ordinary for adventurers, it is still amazing to take note that the landscape of this river is what makes the journey different and astounding.

The boat ride under the cave was exciting and relaxing. Can really feel and feel the beauty and wonder of creation. In some parts the cave roof was lower so we need to exercise care and individual alertness. Makes it more fun. We had a chance to try paddling as well although we seems to slow down the boat than helping but that part of the fun. We had an enjoyable time.

This place is a world heritage site, hence the hefty price of 250000pp, which is very pricy! It should be 100k less but it is what it is. The scenery is phenomenal and breath taking, absolutely beautiful. Would highly recommend going on a boat. There are four routes to take, usually lasting around 3 hours, there are temples and caves along the way to visit. Overall great experience but should be cheaper.

data.formatted_address: Trường Yên, Hoa Lư, Ninh Bình, Vietnam

reviews.text:
A nice spot! Well maintained and pretty. Water isn’t very clear, though I’m sure that depends on time of year and day.

We rented bicycles outside and were frustrated we had to pay to leave ours outside and rent their bicycles if we wanted to bike inside. (And also an entrance fee)

In hindsight, the lake is so small you can easily walk around it with no bicycles.

A really beautiful and magical place to be. We were here for about an hour and a half and took bikes. Come in the morning when it's not really hot yet. What we really liked here is that there are bicycles with auxiliary wheels for children so that even the little ones can ride a bicycle.

This place was OK- I wouldn’t call it a “must” for Ninh Binh area. The lake is small, don’t waste your money on a bike. You can’t bring in outside bikes and must pay for parking. The cave temple is very nice. I would only come up here if you’re already in the area or making a stop on a longer bike ride around Trang An.
Nice place .. people usually use this spot to make marriage photo shot ,we met a Vietnamese famous singer here

Beautifully peaceful place when I visited on a Saturday afternoon.
Calming lake with surrounding mountains, temple and cave.
Really enjoyed a couple of chillout hours walking and sitting outside a cafe here on a Saturday afternoon.

data.formatted_address: 6WFH+MXC, Ninh Hải, Hoa Lư, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Thai Vi Temple

reviews.text:
A temple located in the middle of the nature, surrounded by rice fields, small rivers and limestone mountains.

Recommend cycling or motorbiking to this temple as the village is poetic and beautiful, especially on beautiful days.

You don't have to buy tickets here. Thai Vi temple looks quite similar to other temples in Vietnam, nothing too special about the temple but the way to this temple is worth.

Large and easy parking place. Follow the small trail to the back of the temple to reach a small pier with magnificent view.

The man who is taking care of the temple is interesting and can play musical instruments very well.
Not to far from all the other attractions is this neat ancient temple setting with tranquil mountain surroundings, worth little effort to see for the experience

A pretty Vietnamese Buddhist temple!

It was lovely to visit a temple where you can stop, park your bike/scooter and not get asked for parking fees! This is a small temple where you are welcomed inside and get to see the beautiful shrines.

A man welcomes you inside and then will play a couple traditional instruments, bring smaller cash to make a donation at the end! You will see his photos on the wall!

I recommend cycling the area to look at the temples, cemetery and to look at all the people on the boats pass by. I went in the morning around 11am and it wasn’t too busy.

Nice journey from the town to get there and an elderly man based there is a talented musician who plays for the visitors. The man/music is what made the visit special, the site itself looked like it needed some care.
Small temple easy to reach from the center with the bike. Worth it on a sunny day for the view and the bike ride.

data.formatted_address: Ninh Hải, Hoa Lư, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Động Thiên Hà

reviews.text:
Accessible through the boat station. The locals told us that we can go to Thung Nham by this road, however, there would be more fees charged.
The road is available by boat and by foot. You'll need someone to take you by boat to the cave then you'll walk, so cannot escape paying for the boat.
The walking route is basically a rice paddy.
200k/person, reasonable comparing to Trang An. Also, i like it more since not many people visit this place

This is the best cave I ever seen in Ninh Binh so far.ticket is 120,000 vnd for short route and 200,000 vnd for longer route. The cave is amazing and well maintained, short walk through tree bamboo then you will enter the on land part of the cave, keep going then you will reach the water part of the cave where you will use boat to keep exploring. This part is the best in my trip. Highly recommended
Just a warning you definitely can't access this through the bird sanctuary despite the map where the pin is. You have to go around on the long busy road.
Its so amazing

The most beautiful cave in Ninh Binh, with the experience of rowing a boat to see stalactites of many colors and shapes, even forming natural rock formations.
The scenery is full of beautiful mountains and rivers
This place deserves more attention. Much more beautiful than Bich Dong, as well as the caves in Trang An, Thung Nham, Thung Nang...

data.formatted_address: Yên Sơn, Nho Quan District, Ninh Bình 430000, Vietnam
data.name: Galaxy Grotto Tour Center

reviews.text: We did this as a Christmas day treat and it was truly magical!!! Bit of a way out of town but if you have a moped it's a great sparcley travelled spot where we had the caves to ourselves. Our guide was a lovely lady and her strength and informative use of Google translate was made the trip more immersive. Really worth a visit for any cave lovers but if your scared of snakes best to go in the day time as they prey on the bats as the sun goes down.

this would have been 5 stars but our guide spoke no English and did not try to converse with us using Google translate.  we just followed his hand gestures and enjoyed the boat cruise through the caves

This could be the greatest of Ninh Binh's "water caves" but for the distance of 25km from Tam Coc main tourist centre, most of it via a heavily used transport artery.
From the Galaxy Grotto Tour Centre in Yen Son, you go by row boat to the entrance area. From there it is a 1km walk to the Thein Cave complex where you pick up a second boat that floats through a kilometre of so of underwater riverine caves, backlit in places with multi-coloured lights.
I thought the "Galaxy" side of things was due to planetary type formations. Not so. The stalactites/mites here for an unknown reason have taken the shape of what seems like set pieces for Alien or any number of other SciFi movies.
Even though the water is not crystal clear, if there is no other boat traffic around, it does a magnificent job of reflecting the roof, so it seems you are sailing both below and above the same formations. Fantastic effect!
There are several steep but short stone steps into the cave and numerous tiny Myotis hasseltii Vesser bats on the ceilings of the cave - so consideration should be given to bring young children along. However the bats are harmless and fly quickly away and not a worry.

The Dark Cave is just that and is navigated with the torches provided by the boat captain. A bit spookier and the reflections now are only where you shine the torches - which can be startling at the time. There is a large stalamite 3/4s of the way down that is suppose to be a Buddha.
Mostly a group based tour due to both the distance and the need to pay for boat operators (so 2 is usually minimum/maximum). Prices for the boats range from 150-250k VND but expect to pay double that for a solo traveller.
note: can close when waters rise during the long wet season.

This is one of the best attractions in this place. The caves are beautiful and still alive. You could see the glittering shine when you take a cruise inside. This cave is one of the longest ride you will find around 700m. The guy who organize tours here is a very friendly person.

It is a very beautiful scenic area!  The scene of the traditional northern village is fully converged here: gardens, fish ponds, creased houses with terracotta roof tiles, ... and surrounding the village are fields and meandering rivers.  The landscape is still, but still alive, with the herds of buffaloes chewing slowly, the ducks crowding each other for food.  After exploring the countryside by bicycle, we learned to make cakes.  and then go by rowing boat to explore galaxy caves (including galaxy caves, celestial cave and boudda cave).
Thien Ha is the largest and most beautiful cave in Ninh Binh area (the area of ​​Ha Long Bay on land).  And in particular, this is the only land-water cave: from the ferry, visitors have to walk through the "bamboo forest to form an arch" and climb up the cave entrance, then after the first part of the cave visit, visitors will go by rowing boat to explore deep into this vast cave. And when you come here, you can only have a single attitude of admiring the work of nature that has been formed continuously for hundreds of millions of years!

data.name: Hang Múa

reviews.text:
5/5 Hand Mia cave is kind of 400 midi trek with big steps

Wear breathable dress and take water and coconut 🌴 for energy choose good times for trek for best view morning or evening.
Hard trek and best view kind of adventure 🫶🏻👍💫

Crazy amazing views as you ascend and return from the peak. Over 400 big steps to the top, so make sure you're fit for trek The lotus fields at the base are spectacular 🪷

It was an amazing view from the top but a very good walk up if you’re in the mood for some exercise. It was about 500 steps, which seems like a lot but the view makes up for it.

We went through the dragon route which was higher and probably had better views. Although the dragon path was very steep and there were no dedicated steps around it so I would advise to be really careful.

I recommend going early in the morning cos it’ll get more uncomfortable as the sun comes up. Also recommend using insect repellent before you go up.

All in all a 10/10 experience.

Beautiful view of the lotus garden. It was drizzling when we went here. The surrounding landscape is gorgeous. Lot of small shops all around to sit and relax. We didn’t climb as the stairs were slippery. It wasn’t crowded when we came here.

It starts all a bit weird with people on the road towards the entrance claiming to have your vehicle parked at a certain spot. We parked just next to the entrance at the end of the road for 5000 VND per bicycle. The park fee is 100k (€4) VND pp. The park is very well-maintained and clean. Enough to explore and playgrounds for the younger stars. I do miss some additional information about certain expressions of art and the meaning of the figures depicted. the caves at the foot of the mountain are nice to see but not spectacular. an option for wearing a helmet for tall people would be desirable. watch your head. The way to the top is ahead, be prepared and it is not something to underestimate. especially when it is wet, good shoes are recommended. Halfway up, there is the possibility of buying a refreshment for those who did not bring any; I would recommend bringing at least a bottle of water with you. Once at the top, your efforts will be rewarded.

Lots of stairs but a great view at the top and along the way. Gets very busy so I’d recommend going earlier in the day! Also better as it gets very hot midday. The views are wonderful and there’s places to rest along the way, then 2 different sets of stairs with different views at the top. Well worth the climb!

data.formatted_address: 7VG8+98, Gia Sinh, Gia Viễn District, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Bai Dinh Pagoda

reviews.text:
The average tourism temple we visited so far. Its just simple simple with vast area .
I don’t know why there is electric car from ticket counter 2km away from temple??It's a large area with different buildings and lots to explore. But it seems over the top that the parking lot is several kilometers away and you must take the transport with electric cars. With motorbike parking, it's 75k and takes about 30 minutes extra.
I prefer the smaller, less spectacular but easy-going temples.

It was a large complex of temples and pagodas that takes at-least 4 hours to explore if you want to visit everything. We took the electric car service which drops you from one location to the next. The system is a little confusing because some things are not labelled correctly on the map. But overall, the electric car was worth it. Because it is a lot of walking and hiking if you go up to see the older temples and caves on the hill. Our package came with a herbal foot soak which felt amazing after all the walking.

What a beautiful and organized experience! The temples are astonishing, if you're in the area you've got to go. Beware, prepare to wait for the electric cars to fill up before you can move to the next temple. And cover those shoulders/knees!

Nice to see and with to visit.
Prices from 10.000 VND up to 500.000 VND. For us the cheapest ticket was good enough.

Our visiting time was from 8.00-10.00, so there were no other tourist than us (I guess the busses com in around 11 and later).

The larges pagoda complex in Southeast Asia so I think worth visiting.

Down vote for the ridiculous large parking lot and the personal not always as friendly as you might expect from such a tourist attraction.

You have to park a long way from the ticket place for some unexplained reason, and it's a massive car park. Price list next to ticket booths. To enter you have to pay 60k for the electric car, which takes you to the south end of the park next to the lake. You then have to walk north through some temples and up lots of steps. If you want to visit the pagoda pay an extra 40k at the entrance. There is an elevator up most of it. But to get there you need to navigate the temples, steps and grounds. The buildings are spectacular and there are lots of Buddhas and gold. Great views from the top of the pagoda. To pick up the electric car back to the car park you have to walk further north through more temples and pagados, and up more steps. Alternatively, you can pay more for shuttle bus which takes you to each temple along the route. The site is vast and worth a visit. It will take at least 2 hours to see everything. Much more if you take lots of photos and stops. Plenty of places to buy food and drink along the way. It's all very new and still being built.

If u are interested in history, this is great place to visit. Not crowded, nice staffs

Ninh Binh Museum is located in the south of Thuy Son Cultural Park, designed with 3 floors like a lotus flower emerging in the middle of green mountains and blue water, all four sides are decorated with bronze drum symbols - a symbol of Vietnamese civilization. neck.
Ninh Binh Museum was inaugurated on September 1, 1995 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the National Day of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam (1945 - 1995). With 1,200m2 of use, including 500m2 of display, through documents, artifacts, and images, the Museum vividly reflects the beauty of an ancient land "Lovely Country" and the process of struggling to build the land. country, defending the country heroically by the people of Ninh Binh. L
This is a small museum but very interesting if you take the time to look closely

I came here after a long in evening as per timing mentioned in google but it is closed

A great place to chill or contemplate, with lots of books and beautiful plants. Depending on the time of year, there are also many interesting and meaningful exhibitions about folk culture and history.

The people at Ba Ngan Art are very gentle and friendly.
In addition to beautiful landscapes, this is also a place you can visit to enjoy art in Ninh Binh.

My favourite part of my trip to Vietnam. This boat ride was magical. So peaceful and beautiful. The rowers are incredibly strong! They are also so nice and friendly. Dropped you off at multiple stop points so you can look around and take pictures. I'd definitely recommend coming here to get a glimpse of the beauty Ninh Binh has to offer. ❤️
A beautiful day with amazing scenery. Although it is a popular destination, the river tour is well organized and friendly. The river is part of a conservation area and immaculately maintained.

data.name: Phim Trường Kong Skull Island

reviews.text:
I recently visited Phim Trường Kong: Skull Island in Tinh Ninh Bình and was thoroughly impressed by the beauty of the place. The scenery is stunning, with breathtaking views that truly make you feel like you’re on a movie set.

However, be prepared for the heat, as it can get quite warm during the day. Despite this, the experience is well worth it. If you opt for the package tour, the last stop will be at this location. From there, they conveniently take you back to the ticket counter area by buggy, which is a nice touch and makes the journey more comfortable.

Overall, it was a wonderful visit, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to explore the beauty of Ninh Binh.

Would highly recommend this route if you are opting for your visit to Trang An. Of course it is fake but it is very picturistic. Just take note that taking photos or buying anything with the people there must pay. If you do not wish to pay, just move on.

A very beautiful island.  Thousands of domestic and foreign tourists visit here every day.  The island has a gift item shop, restaurant and washroom facilities.  The island is very beautifully decorated.  A very beautiful view of the island is available on the top of the hill.

Pristinely preserved, with number of islands pagodas & 5-6 fantastic water caves. The Skull Island is still has some of the well preserved movie sets & props. The boat ride is about 2 hrs long & is  just amazing & out-of-world

Perhaps it was bad timing, but the whole place was ‘dusty’ all day long. Damper on an otherwise likely amazing piece of nature’s art. This is essentially a mini Halong Bay, with caves... which looks to be artificially enlarged. Didn’t like the temples (which were built recently, but designed to look antique). The Kong Movie set is also a disappointment. If u came here expecting Hollywood-esque, Universal Studio’s style recreation... u will be sorely let down.

But for a 200k ticket price, it pays for a nice quiet boat ride thru the Red River Delta. Just don’t expect too much UNESCO hype.

data.name: Ecotourism parks Bird Park Thung Nham

reviews.text: Came to see the birds and hike around. Areas were closed to construction and we only saw one type of bird, but it was still worth your time if you have two or so hours to spare. There’s apparently a poop you can pay extra to use that looks very nice, but we did not do it. Certain areas can get touristy, but the off-the-beaten path cave and nature hike are nice and secluded. We generally enjoyed our time here. We did not stay here for lodging, just payed the entrance fee to see the conservation areas.
Beautiful area to walk around or take boat. Still under construction in some parts but well worth the visit for the scenery.

Very peaceful. If you are not booking a room there,  go in the afternoon when there are more birds come back to their nests.  Local Grab can take you there, but you may have a hard time finding a ride back to your outside hotel. Also ride from the ticket booth to the park is long, perhaps not so convenient for taxi drivers to wait for customers.

Amazing spot to cycle in nature!

Sơ Đồ Tham Quan Khu Du Lịch Sinh Thái Thung Nham, also known as Thung Nham Ecotourism Area, is a hidden gem in Ninh Binh, Vietnam. This ecotourism site offers a harmonious blend of natural beauty, rich biodiversity, and serene landscapes, making it an ideal destination for nature lovers and those seeking tranquility.

Thung Nham is blessed with breathtaking scenery, featuring lush forests, stunning limestone mountains, and pristine lakes. The boat rides through the serene waterways are particularly enchanting, providing an intimate view of the surrounding nature. The area is home to numerous bird species, making it a paradise for bird watchers.

Key attractions within Thung Nham include the Bird Valley, where visitors can witness flocks of birds returning to their nests at sunset—a truly mesmerizing sight. The Buddha Cave is another highlight, with its unique rock formations and spiritual ambiance. Additionally, the Fairy Cave and the ancient banyan tree are must-visit spots that showcase the area's natural and cultural heritage.

Thung Nham offers a range of activities to immerse visitors in its natural beauty. Guided boat tours, bird watching, and trekking are popular choices. The eco-friendly accommodations provide a comfortable stay while ensuring minimal impact on the environment. For those interested in local culture, Thung Nham also offers insights into traditional Vietnamese agricultural practices.

The ecotourism area is easily accessible from Hanoi and other nearby cities, making it a convenient escape for a day trip or a longer stay. The facilities are well-maintained, and the staff are welcoming and knowledgeable, enhancing the overall experience.

Sơ Đồ Tham Quan Khu Du Lịch Sinh Thái Thung Nham is a serene and picturesque destination that captures the essence of Vietnam's natural beauty. With its diverse attractions, peaceful atmosphere, and commitment to ecological preservation, it offers an unforgettable experience for all who visit. Highly recommended for those seeking to connect with nature and enjoy a tranquil retreat.
Very large and beautiful area! An unforgettable experience is to ride a boat in a cave. I highly recommend visiting this place.

It is beautiful, even in foggy weather, but looks as newly built (like bigger bigger biggest in mind?). There are 6 ticket options, of which the most extensive one will take you 4 hours to see everything. We took option 1, of which the ending was a long walk back to the electrical car that drives you back to a super large, newly built (not finished yet) parking lot, which is rather industrial looking , and truly mega large in set up. It's not my taste, and I guess in high season, I think this means it will be super super bussy.

What I found difficult is that with ticket selling, they have ladies that know some english and try to get you the more expensive options of tickets, but you don't really know where you are paying for. The complex is rather large, so we choose option 1.

Point which I hope will change / improve sooner than later: large groups, lead by a guide that is shouting through a carry on amplifier / speaker, which is deafening as bystander or just passing when passing along. And also a lot of others, in these groups, are more shouting than talking towards each other. Doesn't look aggressive, but it is more than just loud talking. In a sacret place, I find that more strange than that it is annoying as well.

Khu Du Lịch Tâm Linh Lừa Đảo - Buddhism ia not about material gain. I was not allowed entrance if I did not buy service for electric vehicle. I decided to walk, but they still blocked me from entering. This is a disgrace to true Buddhism

data.formatted_address: 6W99+C23, Ninh Hải, Hoa Lư, Ninh Bình 430000, Vietnam
data.name: Bich Dong Pagoda

reviews.text: Photogenic entrance to the temple.  the temple itself is worth seeing.  go inside and find the stairs up, you will see the surroundings from the terrace in the rock.  Don't be fooled into parking!  Entrance to the temple and parking is free.  leave your scooter in front of the Gao restaurant, the owner is very nice and the parking is free.  drink delicious coffee instead ;)

It’s an interesting temple, I believe it is slightly unique but fairly simple. If you like temples I’d say it’s worth a visit. It is very pretty and fairly quiet. Free entry but it’s a 10k charge for parking, including bicycles. There’s some interesting posters displayed at the temple, I haven’t seen anything like these before. Funny and also an interesting concept.

This place was just okay. Worth the visit as it's easy to get to and has no cost. There is a cave full of bats above you which was kind of cool. The stairs up to it were insanely slippery and dangerous sk be careful.
There's is a small hike to the top with various temples on the route. The view at the top is blocked by trees so don't come if you're after a view.
If you dress to skimpy they will make you put on some extra coverings (they provide for free)

Cool visit. If you end up paying 10, 20 or 30k for parking the scooter and bike seem to be up to the persons mood…
Would recommend giving them a 10 though as this should be a free pagoda.

Everybody is gonna be at the beginning wanting a picture. Decent amount of your busses arriving all the time for a place like this… 15-20 walk around. Optional if you want to go up, you’ll come by a pretty smelly bay cave and reach a little spot at the top

such beautiful nature and history. there is free parking at one of the restaurants on the road and entrance is free. make sure to show respect and cover arms and legs as it is a religious and cultural place.

data.formatted_address: Khu Du Lich Sinh Thai, Thung Nham, Hoa Lư, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Thung Nham Bird Valley

reviews.text:
Amusement park! I was expecting a tranquil, natural setting with some wetlands and birds. Instead this felt much more like Disneyland. We did go on a holiday weekend and there were throngs of Vietnamese tourists. We got there around 4:30pm on a Saturday which was just in time apparently, since after elbowing our way thru the crowds to get on a boat, there were huge lines when we got off the boat.
All that said, we did see an insane amount of birds on the boat ride, which lasted maybe 25min or so. The grounds are also very lovely and we only explored about half of the area. Really beautiful bonsai trees and landscaping. We took the electric tram out to the boat launch and walked back. If you had plenty of time and it weren’t wicked hot, it would be nice to walk the entire thing.
It’s not free to go here. We paid 150k/person for entry which included the boat ride. We paid an additional 40k/person for the electric tram, which maybe wasn’t necessary but was pretty affordable in any case. We also paid 20k to park our motorbike.
My suggestion: check this place out in the evening, say around 5pm, on a weekday—and definitely not on a holiday! And don’t expect a natural setting—expect boardwalks, gift shops, restaurants, all the trappings of a theme park

We went around 9am on Thursday end of July so it wasn't too busy. The park entry fees costs 150k and includes boat rides. Because of the season the caves were not safe to enter either by foot or boat so we can't comment, but the birds sightseeing boat ride which lasts around 30mins was quite a pleasant experience. We didn't see as many birds as we were told they'd flock back around 3pm onwards but it's still cool to see different birds in their natural habitat. The ecopark however was full of butterflies and flowers which was quite pretty.

When we come back next time we'd probably aim to come when it's fruit season and later in the afternoon so we can see more birds and pick fruits.

A nice day out exploring the grounds and caves. I wouldn't put it at the top of the list for Ninh Binh, but if you have some extra time it's a nice spot to get away from all of the European tourists. The cave boat tour is pleasant as well, you can see lots of bats in there.

You can drive up on a scooter and grab tickets at the gate a kilometre or so from the park on the main road.

The cave just after the ticket office has around 450 steps. It might be the sweatiest I have ever been!

This place is sadly not tourist friendly
A ticket to enter Bird valley is 120,000 dong. You buy your ticket at the booth which is about 1 k from the entrance. The signage is difficult to follow and understand if you are not Vietnamese.
After getting your ticket you drive to the entrance and park. We paid 10,000 dong for our scooter. The entrance is in front of you and you scan in on your ticket. The ticket gives you access to two short boat rides. One through a cave and one to Bird Island. Both are pleasant experiences. You can wander through the park then and see the flowers and gardens which are pretty well kept.
The single best bit about the park is hidden behind bushes and this is the swimming pool pictured below.
You have to buy a ‘combi’ ticket to get access which is 100,000 ( on top of your park ticket 120,000 dong ) each. No one tells you about it and there are no signs about it.
You access through a turnstile with your combo ticket. We arrived at 10 am on a friday and by 2 pm we were the only ones there ! Amazing.
So bring your swimwear for a nice swim after your tour of the gardens.
We found out that you cannot buy a single ticket at 100,000 dong for the pool only which will explain why no one uses it . Bizarre. But if you want to pay the combo price you can just use the pool for the day.
Don’t make the mistake of thinking that you can walk straight to the pool and go through the turnstile though. You will meet a man with a flag and a whistle who waves the flag in your face blows his whistle aggressively at  you and stomps his feet like a child. He is security to make sure you first go through the main entrance and walk about 500 metres to get to the turnstile you could have just walked 50 metres to. Go figure 🤷‍♂️

We almost didn’t go due to some of the negative reviews. We are SO glad we went. Even if you didn’t see a bird, the landscaping, flowers, sculptures, and gardens are gorgeous. To see the birds you take a 30 min or so boat ride to the sanctuary part. We saw hundreds of birds nesting in the trees. We heard that after 4 pm is when the birds are in their nests, so we did the boat part around 4:15. Fantastic! Maybe they are also present in the morning (park opens 7:30 am), but first hand we saw many birds in late afternoon in March. Maybe the negative reviewers went in the heat of the day or a time of year when they’re not there??… I can’t say. This was the highlight of our time in this area Tam Coc. Important: separate from admission, you pay another fee to use the electric shuttles. Save that ticket! The park is many many acres and you will definitely want to use the electric shuttles. Super convenient you can even message the driver for pickup. Be sure to do the flower garden area, there are flowers all over the place, but there is a special garden area that’s off the hook and even a small windmill in a nod to the gardens near Amsterdam. This place is a beautifully manicured and well curated experience. Maybe that’s what people meant by ‘theme park’.  We are two Americans and a native Vietnamese and we all absolutely loved it. The only thing I didn’t think was all that great was the mermaid cave… Not because of all the steps to get into it but because once you’re there, you have to crouch low due to the overhanging rocks. Skip that, but make this park and bird sanctuary a must-see destination unless you dislike beautiful gardens and landscaping. Oh, also, as it gets closer to dusk, the lanterns that dot the whole place get turned on, and it’s even more beautiful.

data.formatted_address: 30, lane 96 Trịnh Tú, street, Ninh Bình, 430000, Vietnam
data.name: Ninh Binh Tourist Center Vietnam (Visit by appointment only)

reviews.text: Wonderful way to see Ninh Binh at your own speed and with the tours you want to see, instead of through a large tour bus dictating times. Our driver arrived on time, he didn't speak English but this wasn't an issue as we were tired and used the drive there and back to nap and we used whats app to communicate when we were ready to be picked up at our stop or to answer any questions we had. He was never more than a couple minutes away. This was exactly the tour you want to see the sights you want in Ninh Binh, which is an area not to be missed. Many other day tours didn't offer everything we wanted to see, Ninh Binh Tourist  Center did, plus many more. Thank you for a lovely day tour!

I booked a transfer to Hanoi airport from Tam Coc. Everthing was fine. The driver was on time at the hotel to pick us up, drove very safely and the car was clean.
They are very efficient and professional confirming and reconfirming the service.
I'll recommend my relatives or friends visiting the area to choose Ninh Binh Tourist Center for what they may need.

Straddling through the Foothills of Ninh Binh Province, with the best of Ninh Binh's Travel Companies & Vegetarian Food
Ninh Binh is immense, and to navigate swiftly through its immensity is an actual challenge, something that requires an appropriate guidance. Luong from the Ninh Binh Tourist Center sufficed us with that honourable counsel.

The entire travel company has nothing but been extremely kind and professional since the communication broke out between us amonth ago. Six members of the family out of who three are strictly vegetarian (we are from India); and among these three, one has special meal request due to blood sugar problems; we were extremely grateful to the entirety of local amiable folks who hosted us for lunch, because, honestly, we were served with highly flavourful and extremely delicious Vegetarian Vietnamese Food (probably the best vegetarian meal in the whole country). This was the cherry on top of the cake :)

We were in Ninh Binh only for eight hours, yet we felt that we spent eternity there, because we were taken to a multitude of sites, enormously spiritual temples to cruising slowly through beautiful hills alongside the white dragon river; the day spent is memorable and words bound us to summarise it in mere words.

So all in all, thankyou very much, to the whole Ninh Binh Tourist Center Team, who were perpetually ready to help and guide us make this trip reach stars 🙏🏽🙏🏽🙏🏽

Great day at Mua Caves, Tam Coc River and Pagoda. Out local guide Tung was informative,  funny and made sure the kids were safe and happy.
The price was cheaper than all the other quotes we received, however the fact that the driver spoke very little English made it hard to ask questions about the sights along the way.

We booked several weeks Vietnam, as a winterstay, in Ninh Binh. The service we got was excellent, our stay at the An Phu Homestay was very pleasant, including the good dinners in their restaurant. Unfortunately we needed extra medical care in the Hospital in Hanoi and Ninh Binh Tourist Centre gave us all  the extra care and service  we needed.

data.formatted_address: 7W39+7G5, Ninh Xuân, Hoa Lư District, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Trang An Departure Boat Ticket

reviews.text: It was pouring with rain and we arrived soon after it opened, so zero queues. The river level was high, however our rower still took us on route 3 through 3 sets of caves, the first of which was so low we had to sit on the floor of the boat and frequently duck to avoid losing our heads. Spectacular scenery and temples. A must visit activity if you're in the area.

Known as Ha Long bay of land, its the best boat tour we've ever experienced! The scenery was breathtaking. We had ample time to explore the attractions at each stop (stops vary depending upon the tour you've opted for). Despite the number of tourists, the entry to the complex was hassle-free (we went in low season, first week of June). We recommend avoiding the peak season due to reported wait times exceeding 2 hours.

One standout feature was the provision of umbrellas, which was a lifesaver on a hot, sunny day—something you don't get with the Tam Coc boat tour. There's also a café in the complex offering beverages, baked goods, and ice cream if you need quick refreshments. I really liked Vietnamese coffee they served here.

Overall, a must-visit destination!

We had an amazing experience doing tour 4 today. Our guide barely spoke any English but he was really friendly and skilled with the skulls. Because we were two people we had to wait 20 minutes because they want to fill the four seated boats. When nobody else wanted to do tour 4 we were allowed to go on a private boat. I promise you won't be disappointed if you choose tour 4 as well! Going early in the morning means it not as crowded yet and also not as hot.

Simply amazing.

One of the best activities we took part in on our month-long trip around Vietnam. We arrived by scooter around midday. There is a big parking lot and you pay 15,000 VND for parking. From the car park you had to go to the ticket counter where you can choose between the normal ticket for 250,000 or the combo ticket for 300,000. We chose the ticket for 250,000 and chose tour 1.

The tour was fantastic. We saw such beautiful nature and we didn't expect it to be so great. We saw many beautiful temples and especially the boat ride through so many caves was a great experience. These caves were so impressive that we felt like we were in Disney World or some other theme park.

Before getting on the boat we bought some snacks and used the facilities in the waiting area. The boat trip took 2 1/2 hours. The boat will stop at a point where you can buy water snacks and use the toilets.

I would definitely recommend this trip.

Very easy to understand and very systematically made. It is one of the most beautiful memories I'm going to take back from vietnam. The scenery is stunning, and it surely feels straight out of a movie scene. The natural caves are mesmerizing! It's quite hot, and i would recommend that you carry a fan and a plenty of water to drink along the way. We got a really good climate as it was cloudy, so not very sunny, but still quite humid. We chose route 2, and it was a perfect mix of pagodas (temples) and limestone mountain views. We also saw spots where king kong was shot! Our boat lady was the sweetest! We loved the experience here!

data.formatted_address: Ninh Hải, Hoa Lư, Ninh Bình 430000, Vietnam
data.name: Tam Cốc – Bích Động - Ninh Bình, Việt Nam

reviews.text: Tam Coc lived up to expectations. River ride where your guide uses their feet to navigate and row the boat is unusual but effective. Sit back enjoy the views of rock peaks rice paddies and caves. Well worth thepney paid. Others are people on the river that will come upto you to offer to take your photo but be warned it does come at a price. Even though tipping is not custom it would seem 20.000d is given per person. Remember you do not need to offer if you do not wish to.

Interesting spot, but a little over the top on tourism. Strange to see so many tourists getting paddled along the river by boat operators using their feet to navigate and propel their crafts. Seems a bit unseemly.

Would be a nicer spot without all the wholesale tourism and related infrastructure. Beautiful scenery, regardless.

Good during rain or shine. And no mosquitos, in March anyway.
Decent boat ride but cannot be compared to Trang An! Weather can be very hot and sunny. My boat rower was nice and can communicate in chinese, but she does keep asking me for more tips….

Still under-crowded gem a bit out of Nin Binh. Day trippers do crowd the visiting sites but it’s a wonderful place to stay. Recommend the lake trip through the caves and the Mua Cave. Definitely grab yourself a bike or a scooter for easy access everywhere

During my visit to Hanoi in February, I had the opportunity to explore the breathtaking beauty of Tam Cốc – Bích Động in Ninh Bình, Vietnam. This hidden gem left me in awe and provided a truly memorable experience.
Tam Cốc - often referred to as the "Halong Bay on land" - is a scenic landscape filled with limestone karsts and winding rivers. The boat ride along the Ngo Dong River was the highlight of my visit. As we glided through the serene waterways, surrounded by limestone cliffs and lush greenery, I felt like I had entered a tropical paradise.
The area is famous for its caves, and Bích Động was a standout attraction. Climbing steep stone steps and exploring the cave complex was an adventure in itself. The intricate network of pagodas and temples nestled within the natural caves added to the mystique and spiritual atmosphere.
What made this destination truly special was its peacefulness and tranquility. The absence of crowds allowed for a more intimate experience, and I was able to fully appreciate the natural beauty and surrounding serenity.
The local people were friendly and welcoming, and their hospitality added to the overall charm of the place. They were eager to share their knowledge and stories about Tam Cốc, enhancing my understanding and appreciation of this unique destination.
Visiting Tam Cốc – Bích Động in Ninh Bình was an unforgettable experience that showcased the natural beauty and cultural richness of Vietnam.

reviews.text: Many faulty products and dishonest sellers, foreigners beware!

A great place to buy anything you want. But if you want to buy fresh food, vegetables or fruit, you have to come in early morning to get the good quality with cheapest price. Other things you can buy at anytime of the day. But remember it's closed at about 6:00 pm to 7:00 depend on each store.
Very run down. Do not come here! It looks abandoned.

It was an experience all right. In the main building there is mostly dried goods, coffee, tea, plastic flowers, fishing rods and some other stuff.  Outside there is everything you could think off.. a large fresh fruit section, meat section (including dead dogs). Many tea vendors and other food goods. Cheap clothes shops. Most people did not speak English but they always find a way to communicate with you and for the most part we’re quite friendly.

It's ok, there's not much in downtown Ninh Binh to do, so it was worth walking around in. This was maybe more authentic than the other markets we've been to since it was catering to the locals and not tourists.

data.formatted_address: 8J85+MFX, Nho Quan District, Ninh Bình 432857, Vietnam
data.name: Cuc Phuong National Park

reviews.text: I did the 2D1N tour offered by the national park, called "wildlife experience". It included treks in the park, wildlife night spotting, and camping within the park. Communication with the park via email was a bit tricky but in the end everything worked out. I was accompanied by my guide, ranger L (but I don't know if it is written correctly), and a porter, Lang. L was very knowledgeable about the primates (we started the tour with a visit at the primates rescue center) and the species present in the park. The hike through the forest was very cool, we even saw the king Cobra! We hiked for 4 hours until we reached a small stream where we set up the camp. There were really a lot of leeches, so be prepared for that. Lang was born in the primary forest and he was very skilled about life in the forest. For instance, he collected bamboo rots and cooked them inside the bamboo on the fire. We ate dinner and then we went for 1h of night spotting but we didn't see much other than a few spiders. The morning after the hike lasted only 1h, until we reached the main road, where our car was already waiting for us. I would have liked the second day to be a bit longer. The price is a bit high if you go alone, but it was definitely the wildest experience I had so far!

The national park is impressive and the hikes are beautiful and breathtaking (in all senses, including physically). Unfortunately for the wildlife lovers looking to watch wild primates or other mammals on the wild, it is very very hard!!! So don’t get to high expectations! The primate conservation center is depressing! I understand the need of protecting and keeping primates in a controlled space, but unfortunately the cages are still very small and unnatural. I hope they will improve the conditions for those animals! ALSO, we were surprised that on the entry they said we will have a English speaking guide, but the reality was that the guide didn’t say a word in English and we missed all of the relevant information. So not much effort to educate and raise awareness! Fortunately, there was another local visitor that kindly was translating for us the most relevant information.

Terrain can be rough and the bugs are no joke. The markers can be hard to spot on treks. I went on a trail without looking at the details and ended up walking in the jungle for hours. I was lucky to get out before dark. DO NOT DO WHAT I DID. Check the routes and when they tell you to go with a guide, DO IT. Lovely hike though.

Absolutely beautiful canopy forest with over 300 bird species.

We did a day visit, I won't stay here more than a day, except if you want to camp for one night in the forest with a guide. Other than that there is only so much you can do in the park as there is only one road with limited trekking routes. Bathrooms are filthy and restaurants in the area are limited and over priced. I do hope they upgrade the facilities in the future.

Some activities, which include visiting the primate and carnivore conservation centres, which include additional costs. It is definitely worth it and the information is very insightful into how these animals were rescued and to see how they rehabilitate them to be released back into nature.

Beautiful trekking routes, but please note they are +-20 kilometers from the entrance of the park which you have to travel either by car, scooter or bicycle - it is a dangerous narrow road, as the cars speed around the corners. The road is wet which makes it easy for the scooters to slide. Also, unfortunately the "Thousand Year Old Tree" is said to be rotten but there are other beautiful trees in the forest.

Bicycles - I have read previous posts, they have since upgraded their bicycles with new ones.

The botanical garden has a bird hide which you can climb up to (a bit technical, please see last photo).

Cuc Phương National Park is the best in Northen Vietnam for hiking during summer time to view buterflies and fireflies. We hiked about 14 km from Central of the Park (Bong) to Khanh village where Muong ethnic people live and spent one night in the wooden stilt house enjoying a great dinner with the warm hearted Muong host, learned Muong rich culture and observed various species in the tropical forest.

data.formatted_address: Đường Cúc Phương - Bái Đính, Kỳ Phú, Nho Quan, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Ninh Binh Bear Sanctuary

reviews.text:
What an incredible experience! We completed the guided sanctuary tour and it was absolutely worth it! Our guide was amazing. She was very knowledgeable, kind and passionate. We really enjoyed learning about the good work this sanctuary is doing.

Note that bears tend to hide from the heat of the day in spring / summer. At this time of year, you are more likely to see them later in the afternoon.

We paid for a guided tour of the sanctuary, Got to see the bears roaming around and watch a short movie, We also got to walk along the sky walk and view them from above.

The sanctuary is very well maintained, Along with beautiful enclosures for the bears to keep them loving life.

Highly recommend visiting and giving them your support to continue the good work they do, Another notable place to visit would be the Animals Asia bear sanctuary located closer to Hanoi.

The bears are so beautiful, Really enjoyed our tour.

We chose to take a tour of the sanctuary, which was very informative and interesting, albeit sad. The staff were very kind and spoke great English.
Amazing and inspiring work done by this organisation! Would recommend to all :) we were also lucky that our visit coincided with feeding time for the bears (1/1.30pm) so we got to see many of the rescued and rehabilitated animals.

A very good spot to visit the bears and listen to their stories. Even though you cannot see many bears like in the zoos, the guide and the movie will give you a lot of information about the pain that these animals had suffered before moving here, their nursing home for the rest of their life. The kids would love the tour very much.

Absolutely loved this place. The staff are very passionate and knowledgeable about these bears and will not hesitate to educate everyone they can.
Animals of this size require a lot of care, and I am happy to say that this sanctuary supports the bears very well, having suitable enclosures, food, medications, enrichment and more.

I recommend calling ahead to check the tour times (2x per day) and then booking the skywalk and the tour package.
You can rest in the cafe or grab lunch if you arrive early too.

I was also very happy to see new enclosures being built meaning that the sanctuary will have capacity to rescue more individuals.

data.formatted_address: Việt Nam, ĐT20, Sơn Trạch, Bố Trạch, Quảng Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Phong Nha Botanic Garden

reviews.text:
Quite an enjoyable visit. Similar to another reviewer here I made the mistake of assuming this would be a traditional botanic garden (my bad there in not doing the due diligence).

Instead, it offers a forest or jungle walk experience which was quite nice albeit rather hot and humid (in April): The surroundings are beautiful, but it's important to note that the longer walk can be challenging if you’re not used to walking in humid weather. The view from the waterfall was quite picturesque and quite a few folks took a dip in the pool. The viewing point, however, may not offer as rewarding a view and can be difficult to access, making it less worthwhile.

Overall quite a decent place and well worth the visit

The Botanic Gardens, while enjoyable to visit, might not meet expectations as a traditional botanic garden. Instead, it offers a forest or jungle walk experience. The surroundings are beautiful, but it's important to note that the longer walk can be challenging. The view from the waterfall is picturesque, offering a glimpse into the jungle, but the viewing point may not offer as rewarding a view and can be difficult to access, making it less worthwhile. Personally, I found cycling around the area and exploring nature to be a more fulfilling experience, but this preference may vary from person to person.

This garden is lovely, it is more of a walk in the forest as opposed to a botanical garden in the UK. The trees, and other flora that you'll see are wonderful and it is cooler due to the foliage. The view point is nice, a little overgrown but you get an evening nicer one towards the end, spoilers in the pictures. We swam at the Gio falls as well and it was so cool and refreshing, exactly what was needed. We did the 1.5 hour route, but there is also a 0.5 hour and 3 hour route available.

TLDR: very nice walk - recommended, use proper shoes and take enough water and a little energy snack.
....
We cycled all the way from Phong nha to the botanic garden. We had very bad bikes but it was no problem at all. Mostly flat.

BUT: last 800 m are very steep. If you have no gears you need to walk and push.
Please be careful on way back down as these old bikes might not break well enough. Huge risk of crashing. Just walk down as we did.

At the garden bicycles park for free, scooter 5.000 and cars 10.000.

Entrance is 40.000 per person

There are various walks of 0.5 h to 3h.
We did the long walk and it took us 2h in total. So not the 3 h as advertised.

On the way you will find a couple of water holes where people apparently like to cool down.

We didn't but it looked safe. At the end of the walk there is a medium size waterfall with bathing option.

The walk (long one) starts uphill on a path with concrete steps. Easy enough for average fit people.
It is very beautiful and serene.

The last bit before the waterfall was very steep and a little slippery.
There are ropes to support you but a certain strength, agility and balance is needed.
Not recommended in sandals.

There is a little store for drinks/restaurant in front of the garden to charge your battery afterwards.

As a life long motorbike rider, I am always looking for really winding / challenging roads....well is the best I have ever been on. If you google map the surround roads here you will be thrilled but if you choose some longer journeys that will take hours make sure you have survival essentials like water, food, lighter to start fire, knife for defense against anything wild if you're broken down / flat tyre or stacked it no traffic passing no houses near by no ph reception so don't go it alone or without essentails, it is very rewarding ride with so many great pics
