reviews.text:
Peaceful, well kept, and clean boutique hotel ran by a lovely, smiley and friendly owner. She went above and beyond to make our stay feel comfortable and at home. Even though her English isn’t the best, communication flowed. She arranged motor bikes for us as well. We were impressed how she was cleaning the rooms, making everyone healthy breakfast and maintaining the entire place - hats off to her!

The rooms and bathroom were clean and spacious. Lovely views into the garden. We would not hesitate to come back here again!

Quiet street next to the river next to little cafés, restaurants and massage parlors (of which we have visited one of each).
Rooms with huge glass windows, beautiful central garden and most friendly and helpful host. She even gave us water for free for our bus ride and accompanied us to the bus terminus with her bike and carried one of our backpacks.

We could rent bikes and book the bus directly at the premise for a fair price.
We would gladly stay here again.

Ideal location right by the tam coc lake, the room is modern. Shower is perfectly hot, bed is comfy and AC does work as well.  But dac the woman at the hotel is such a good person, she even brought us some fresh fruit at midnight as she knew we’d be leaving at 4am to checkout.

We had a double and a single bed, So recommend it for the price you pay for sure if your looking to explore the ninh binh area 20-40 mins from places like Mua Caves, Trang An, The pagoda etc.. we had a scooter to get around.  There are bicycles on offer too.

A good, clean, cheap hotel with basic breakfast.  There is only one elderly receptionist here, but very helpful and enthusiastic.  The hotel is located close to the main road of this area, surrounded by many restaurants and bars with affordable prices and good quality.  However, the hotel is still very quiet.  Highly recommended.  #khachsandepgiare #dulichvietnam #reviewkhachsan

Great little homestay just a 5 minute walk to Tam Coc centre. Right in front of the lake and close by to some nice Cafes. Very quiet and relaxing location.
The rooms are basic, modern, clean and comfortable.
The lady that takes care of the place was very sweet. Eventhough her English was limited we managed to communicate. She brought us breakfast in the room every morning and cleaned the room every day.
Basic options of eggs, noodles, or pancake for breakfast, and fruit with anything.
Overall lovely stay. We had booked for 3 nights, but stayed for 9 nights as we needed a relaxing break during our travelling and we found this place comfortable.

reviews.text:
The old location of Hoa Lu Ancient Town seems to have disappeared from maps, making it a bit tricky for tourists to find. But it's absolutely gorgeous at night when the lanterns light up the whole area. We took a boat ride, which gave us an amazing view.
The night market along the river has food courts and souvenir shops with lots of local treats and items.
It's a super underrated spot and definitely worth a visit at night.

HOA LU NINH BINH OLD TOWN
Hoa Lu ancient town is located in Ky Lan mountain area, Tan Thanh ward, Ninh Binh city.
In the old town, visitors can admire many works with ancient symbols such as the Tu An Tower located in the middle of Ky Lan Lake, a unique architectural work located within the campus of Hoa Lu old town. Or the Ky Unicorn Stupa (Silver Pagoda) is located at the foot of Ky Lan Mountain. The stupa is 27m high, has 3 levels of curved roof, crafted and built entirely of red Granite.
In particular, Hoa Lu ancient town is designed according to the architecture of ancient cultural spaces, so visitors have many choices to experience daily life from ancient times.
Hoa Lu ancient town has been restored and put into operation and is considered one of the new tourism products of Ninh Binh. Take a trip to visit and enjoy the typical culture, art, and cuisine of the provinces. In the regions here, you will feel many new things: With the architectural space recreating Dai Viet's 10th century, when coming to Hoa Lu ancient town, you will get beautiful photos regardless of where you are. Which corner?
At the end of July, the group of tourists from CGC GDTX Center and Afternoon Star Folk Dance Club came here and really felt many surprises about a poetic and very ancient landscape like an ancient town of Hoi An, Vietnam.
Trieu Vuong will be implemented at the end of July 2024.

A nostalgic, elegant, peaceful place worth experiencing. There are all kinds of services for dining, shopping, entertainment, exhibitions,... typical of Hoa Lu.
Entrance fee to the gong is free. Parking a motorbike is only 5k.
Beautiful, recommended for a walk in the evening.

data.formatted_address: Ninh Thắng, Hoa Lư District, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Lalita Boutique Hotel & Spa Ninh Binh

reviews.text: The staff of the hotel was super amazing. Especially, the Phuong and Tho were outstanding. The room service was up to the mark. The food was amazing the hotel staff was super friendly. Thank you Lalita team for making our stay memorable. Would visit again and again here and love to recommend as many tourist as we can. Thank you:)

So, just spent 4 nights at Lalita Boutique Hotel and Spa in Ninh Binh, Vietnam, and let me tell you, it was absolutely delightful.

The rooms? Big and comfy. The staff? Super friendly and spoke English better than I do on a Monday morning.

The rooftop pool? A total lifesaver on those scorching afternoons. It's like they knew exactly what I needed—a perfect spot to chill and pretend I'm a celebrity hiding from the paparazzi.

They also have free bike rentals, which is great because the town is just a quick 10-minute ride away. Plus, the morning buffet is loaded with Western choices, so you won't be missing your usual breakfast back home.

We did have a little hiccup when our AC decided to take a permanent vacation on the last night, but the staff was on it faster than you can say "superhero landing." They moved us to another room without any fuss. Impressive, right?

All in all, they gave us a fantastic stay with top-notch service. If you're heading to Ninh Binh, this place is a must.

All good.  Wendy and team gave us a nice experience.  The rooms are nice and clean.  It is all new.  The hotel is very short distance from town and bicycles are free to use.  It is walking distance a few minutes.  All good and can recommend.

Rooms were pretty nice.  The pool was lovely - rooftop.  Breakfast was decent but probably not as good as some of the other hotels we stayed at.  But nothing to complain.

The staff was fab.  Very nice, helpful.  They actually discussed restaurants options with us helping us decide where to go for dinner.  And in general gave us lots of tips and guidance.  Chatted very peacefully.

Superb service in a beautiful, spacious hotel near the city center. Just a small walk away from all the restaurants and shops, but in a quiet area.
Super friendly staff that help out where they can. Wendy is a delight, really good at her job in connecting to people and making them feel at home.

reviews.text:
Not much to say. When we got in we did just 2 caves because the tides were high. So it kind of limited the experience for us.

However it was a good experience. Very professional. Although they were way too many people and I felt that kinda led to the long 2-3 hours timeline and not really the activities. Also limited flexibility. Also it was quite difficult to communicate with the man rowing as he didn’t understand any English.

Outside of that, a good activity to appreciate the natural wonder and tick off your bucket list. Best to do early in the morning or later in the evening.

We did tour 3. 1 is cave heavy, 2 is shorter. 250k each (300k for additional bits around like the kong film site).

A must do, going through the 1km long cave was amazing! Absolutely beautiful, took about 2h20m. Helping to row is appreciated, tips not expected but recommended.

Absolutely worth it, motorbike parking 15k from memory.

Beautiful place.  Temples hidden among nature create an amazing atmosphere.  I recommend going early in the morning or late in the afternoon.  help you row, your journey will take up to 3 hours of rowing.  I recommend this place

This was an amazing experience. We were expected to row (not a big deal to me) and the couple in the boat with us were taking photos rather than helping to row for large parts of the tour. They also used umbrellas a good deal so just note your view could be partially obscured at some points. None of this detracted from the tour. I’ve never seen a place so beautiful. Try to go at a time when it it less busy. We went very early before the tourists were bussed in.
Don’t miss this boat ride. We did the ride n3 and loved it. Definitely worth it. It lasted about 2 and a half hours. Went through 3 caves and saw 3 temples.

data.name: Tam coc Rice Fields Resort

reviews.text: Great location, the view is incredible. The staff is lovely and very helpful! The food is cooked on the spot, the rooms are ok, could be refreshed a bit, but for the price of the room I don t see this as something truly ruining the experience. Also, you can use for free the bicycles from the hotel. Good AC, good shower. Really a great moment here.

The bungalows at this hotel are nice, but are starting to look a little run down. For example the mosquito nets are full of holes and not just small ones. The rooms are also made up for winter with bed heaters and winter duvets.

If you stay in a bungalow you're not on the main site and need to walk 25 meters down the road to the area with the amenities. The pool is not very clean with a layer of grease/sun ran lotion across the top and you can't see your feet past the metre mark it's that murky.

The service was awful, the hotel appears to be being run by a bunch of older teenagers with little to no English. The hotel had a good drinks menu but once you pick what you want they tell you they only have Beer, Coke or Water which for a hotel is awful. It's the same with dinner, a big menu of which they only have a few things. The food was just ok but expensive. The second night we sorted ourselves to get into Tam Coc which has many restaurants.

Quite a hit and miss.

The location overlooking the paddies in a quiet corner is a real winner but maintenance, cleanliness, service (or lack thereof) and food send the place rock bottom.

It feels like no one has prior experience in the hospitality industry or an appreciation of what customers might expect — not that we’re very demanding, had excellent experiences in pretty modest home stays.

Another oddity is food being quoted in USD at twice the price you’d pay in the village…

The personal was the best we had in a while, they we‘re so sweet and kind. We even were allowed to stay there the day we checked out until our bus came. The location is a little outside what is quite comforting as the rush from the touristic tam coc was left behind.

We loved it here.

Had a scare with a snake in my room. They transfered us to a new one. To be fair, the hotel is kind of in the jungle, so snakes are expected. So be careful. Location and views are fabulous. The food was below par.

data.formatted_address: 6WWP+5R3, Xuân Thành, Ninh Xuân, Hoa Lư, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Phim trường - Tràng An Garden

data.formatted_address: 6WV6+2FQ, Ninh Hải, Hoa Lư District, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Thung Hang Vạng

reviews.text: A beautiful place that you should visit at least once in your life.

Trang An eco complex is interesting place in Ninh Binh. The peaceful atmosphere, the fresh air, the spectacular mountain and emerald river....make the beautiful Trang An.
The staffs on boat are so friendly and helpful. They are polite. If you are Vietnamese, they are your local guide for you too. I see they have many information which is interesting about Trang An. On boat trip, you can visit the majestic natural., see many kind of plants and animals. Some of them are in Red List.
Love everything in Trang. From nature to Human.
Breathtaking nature and ecotourism. Loved it. Wish the tour lasted longer! Fortunately we didnt go during the peak of the season but there were still a lot of people there so thats a minus.
Good scenery, you should took the longest bamboo boat trip, it's so relaxing
Wonderful tour with funny people all around that want to know you, even the staff. Just smile and they will share every experience they have with you!

data.formatted_address: Khê Hạ, Hoa Lư, Ninh Bình 430000, Vietnam
data.name: Khu du lịch Hang Múa

reviews.text: Accessible for toddlers! My 3 and 5 year-old made it up there! Just make sure you bring lots of water! And plan on 1h to get up there. Then you can spend a lot more time: go to the other peak (if they follow), walk across the rice fields when back down, stop at a Cafe, etc

We had booked this property for one night and had a very bad experience.
Firstly, they do not have anyone to get the luggage ro the room and one has to help themselves.
There was no elevator so the luggage had to be dragged to first floor up almost 30-40 stairs. It gets pitch dark after evening with almost no option to step out and extremely no choice at their restaurant for veg food. Breakfast also had the same issue as we had to order and they did not had any veg option. The veg rice I ordered had ants in it. The night we stayed had heavy downpour and next day the entire resort was floating. There were fishes all around and the staff was busy fishing fresh water fishes.  The whole place had badly flooded  and we just couldn't step out as there were huge water puddles.The washroom was leaking and there was no one to fix.
Do not book this place as it's a disaster.

Just fantastic. Wish we spent more time here. The location is brilliant, set amongst the mountains and forest, the only noise coming from the wild animals in the forest. Lovely spa pool, huge rooms with private terraces, great food and drinks offers. Would highly recommend.

Best place to stay in Nin Binh in centre of May caves. Expensive but worth the money. Wooden bungalows are cozy and luxurious. One small con was there was a bathtub only without a private bathroom. Entry is free for Mua caves for customers and breakfast has lot of vegetarian options.

This,place us amazing..
Definitely the best break from all the hustle and bustle.
There's so much greenery and the air feels fresh.
The hike and bike rides a must aswell.

data.formatted_address: 7WF6+835, Trường Yên, Hoa Lư District, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Tràng An Ancient Temple

reviews.text: Without boat is nothing special, visit 10-15 minutes but it's free.

Me and my friend turned up to the temple around 18.30 because it said “open 24 hours” however there was no one around. We couldn’t find an entrance but I believe you need to get a boat to see anything good.

I wanted to visit the small temple/pagoda on the top, but the steps are completely ruined. You can still walk a bit up, and if you’re feeling adventurous you can see how far you get on the ruined stairs. However, you can still take the boat through the cave and learn some history about the place which is nice, but if like me, you wanted to go to the top, it’s probably still broken
We took a day tour from Hanoi. This temple and the walk up the mountain for the view was a good workout and beautiful
very nice must seen before dying! but let explain the history!

data.formatted_address: 7W2F+MR7, Ninh Xuân, Hoa Lư District, Ninh Bình, Vietnam
data.name: Đảo Khê Cốc - Ninh Bình

reviews.text: Amazing place in Trang An. Buy combined tickets to this village and also the boat ride.

Really enjoyed this experience as someone from the other side of the world, we don’t really have these sort of things so it was a really interesting experience and a lot of discover. The people were pretty nice too!

This newly built attraction is not in line with Ninh Binh tourism, and is a total disrespect towards a UNESCO world heritage site. In the "huts" there are tacky leaf hats and skirts that you can put on for a picture. No info about the supposed "historical" part of it, it all just looks like a movie set. I hope Ninh Binh won't make more Disneyland attraction like this.
Incredible. Got here at 7:30am. No one else there.

The recent development within Ninh Binh's tourist offerings seems misaligned with the essence and integrity of its UNESCO World Heritage site designation. The setup, featuring makeshift huts where visitors can dress up in cliché leaf hats and skirts for photographs, lacks any educational substance or genuine historical context. It resembles more of a theatrical set than a tribute to the region's rich heritage. It is crucial for Ninh Binh to reconsider such ventures that edge closer to theme park attractions rather than authentic cultural experiences.
